channel.title: 508 Gfx, emote, and interface looping
channel.description: How do I loop these subjects? Im trying to figure out emotes for my server and a couple other while trying to find gfxs and interfaces. Please help.

item.title: 508 Gfx, emote, and interface looping
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“XLBuggaLX, post:6, topic:250605”]If your asking for a command emote, I would suggest something like this…

else if (cmd[0].equals("emote")) { p.requestAnim(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0); }

It grabs the number from in front of the emote command, and plays it.

Ex. ::emote 1234. If not, i have no idea o.o.

For GFX’s, instead of; p.requestAnim(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0);

it would be, p.requestGFX(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0);

And look like this;

else if (cmd[0].equals("gfx")) { p.requestGFX(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0); }

If you just want to play a specific emote, it would be… p.requestAnim(####, 0);
or… p.requestGFX(####, 0);

The #### being the emote/gfx ID.

Wow only just noticed how old this post is o.o! Sorry :D.[/quote]
Yeah…look at the date before posting next time.

Read full topic

item.description:
@XLBuggaLX wrote:

If your asking for a command emote, I would suggest something like this…

else if (cmd[0].equals("emote")) { p.requestAnim(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0); }

It grabs the number from in front of the emote command, and plays it.

Ex. ::emote 1234. If not, i have no idea o.o.

For GFX’s, instead of; p.requestAnim(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0);

it would be, p.requestGFX(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0);

And look like this;

else if (cmd[0].equals("gfx")) { p.requestGFX(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), 0); }

If you just want to play a specific emote, it would be… p.requestAnim(####, 0);
or… p.requestGFX(####, 0);

The #### being the emote/gfx ID.

item.title: 508 Gfx, emote, and interface looping
item.dc:creator: @Goodoo_dolls Goodoo dolls
item.description:
@Goodoo_dolls wrote:

Ok then w.e I was asking for a timed event but no one seems to help :(. Also everyone knows I’m right from my post above 90% of this community are noobs, losers, leechers, or stuck ups that think they know everything. All I need is one simple command to do this I’ll code the timers just give me the base for the command.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 14, 2008, 05:45:17 pm[/size]

How would I make this do emotes or gfx’s?} if (cmd[0].equals("reset")&& p.rights >= 1) { for (int i = 0; i < p.skillLvl.length; i++) { p.skillLvl[i] = 1; p.skillXP[i] = 0; p.skillLvl[3] = 10; p.skillXP[3] = 1154; p.appearanceUpdateReq = true; p.updateReq = true; p.frames.setSkillLvl(p, i); }

Help…

item.title: 508 Gfx, emote, and interface looping
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Goodoo dolls:

Wow do you know nothing about 508s? A command would be required to go through all the emotes, gfxs, or interfaces. I don’t know why people ever go to this community with shit mods and ppl thinking they know everything. If you ass holes stop leeching and start thinking for yourself and try to help others this community wouldn’t fucking fail so much!

Then your not looping them, your looping through them. There a difference. Again, use a timed event.
And if you don’t like it, leave.

item.title: 508 Gfx, emote, and interface looping
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

You don’t even make sense. You can’t ‘loop’ and interface. Looping an emote or graphic would be making a timer to do it, because you people love timers.

An event system would be the best way, but thats too complex for you.
